Maruku is a Markdown-superset interpreter that features the standard Markdown, Markdown Extra and Meta-data syntax.

To see this: Type this:
bold 
**bold**
italics 
_italics_
strikethrough 
<del>strikethrough</del>
xsuperscript 
x<sup>superscript</sup>
asubscript 
a<sub>subscript</sub>
code phrase 
`code phrase`
link to Radiant CMS 
link to [Radiant CMS](http://radiantcms.org)
JAA 
<acronym title="Just Another Acronym">JAA</acronym>
Red Text 
<span style="color:red">Red Text</span>

A bulleted list:

  • item one
  • item two
  • item three
 
A bulleted list:
* item one
* item two
* item three

A numbered list:

  1. item one
  2. item two
  3. item three
 
A numbered list:
1. item one
2. item two
3. item three

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

Heading 4

 
Heading 1
---------

Heading 2
=========

### Heading 3

#### Heading 4
Header Header
Cell Cell
Cell Cell 
Header | Header
-------| -------
Cell   | Cell
Cell   | Cell
Header Long Header Header
left-align center-align right-align
left-align center-align right-align 
Header     | Header       | Header      |
-----------|:------------:|------------:|
left-align | center-align | right-align |
left-align | center-align | right-align |
Roses are red, violets are blue, Markdown is nice, and so are you!
 
> Roses are red,
> violets are blue,
> Markdown is nice,
> and so are you!
![alt text](http://radiantcms.org/button.png)

Advanced users may also want to have a look at the Markdown syntax, Markdown Extra syntax and also the Meta-data syntax.
